repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Update and promote `contrib/luarc.json` to `.luarc.json`.

- Nvim's LSP settings are now maintained.
- This will make diagnostics consistent across users.
- Will be required for #24563

---

### Adapting LSP configuration

Use something like the following so RTP isn't added to projects with a `.luarc.json`.


<details>
<summary>Via nvim-lspconfig</summary>

```lua
local nvim_lsp = require('lspconfig')

nvim_lsp.lua_ls.setup {
  on_init = function(client)
    local path = client.workspace_folders[1].name
    if not vim.uv.fs_stat(path..'/.luarc.json') then
      -- Make the server aware of Neovim runtime files
      client.config.settings.Lua.workspace.library = { vim.env.VIMRUNTIME }
      -- or for everything:
      -- client.config.settings.Lua.workspace.library = vim.api.nvim_get_runtime_file("", true)
      client.notify("workspace/didChangeConfiguration", {
        settings = client.config.settings
      })
    end
    return true
  end
}
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>Manually</summary>

```lua
local function find_root(path, markers)
  local match = vim.fs.find(markers, { path = path, upward = true })[1]
  if not match then
    return
  end
  local stat = vim.loop.fs_stat(match)
  local isdir = stat and stat.type == "directory"
  return vim.fn.fnamemodify(match, isdir and ':p:h:h' or ':p:h')
end

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
  pattern = 'lua',
  group = vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('luals', {}),
  callback = function(args)
    vim.lsp.start({
      name = 'luals',
      filetype = 'lua',
      cmd = { 'lua-language-server' },
      root_dir = find_root(args.file, {'.luarc.json', '.git'}),
      on_init = function(client)
        local path = client.workspace_folders[1].name
        if not vim.uv.fs_stat(path..'/.luarc.json') then
          -- Make the server aware of Neovim runtime files
          client.config.settings.Lua.workspace.library = { vim.env.VIMRUNTIME }
          -- or for everything:
          -- client.config.settings.Lua.workspace.library = vim.api.nvim_get_runtime_file("", true)
          client.notify("workspace/didChangeConfiguration", {
            settings = client.config.settings
          })
        end
        return true
      end,
    })
  end,
})
```
</details>

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
```
That's been removed a long time ago.

comment_regular_data.body: I'm not opposed to this, my _only_ thought is that if I want to modify `.luarc.json` to add e.g. `neodev.nvim` to the library paths, is there a way to do that without my worktree constantly being dirty?

There's no need for neodev anymore.

Or is there?

I've added meta files for everything now. Anything that's missing should be added as PR's here (via options.lua or eval.lua) instead of relying on third party code.

> There's no need for neodev anymore.
> 
> Or is there?
> 
> I've added meta files for everything now. Anything that's missing should be added as PR's here (via options.lua or eval.lua) instead of relying on third party code.

Good point, you're probably right.

> There's no need for neodev anymore.

@lewis6991 Could you please elaborate on this? I actually [struggled recently with duplicate results when using `neodev`](https://www.reddit.com/r/neovim/comments/15kv7dv/duplicate_definitionshover_with_neodev/), but when disabling I was unsure of how exactly to configure `lua_ls` in order to get `vim`'s API support. Should [these default settings](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/b6091272422bb0fbd729f7f5d17a56d37499c54f/doc/server_configurations.md#lua_ls) from `nvim-lspconfig` be enough?
I too would like to know how this should be used in combination with the default config for, say, working on plugins or init.lua. Right know, luals loads everything multiple times...

Neodev is half broken right now because it includes `$VIMRUNTIME` and all its generated types. So you will get duplicate types using it.

neodev should be disabled when working on the Neovim codebase. The neodev README explains how to do this.

Neodev also isn't really needed when working on plugins. You just need a `.luarc.json` with `$VIMRUNTIME` included in library.

For the most part neodev isn't really necessary anymore.
I'm not using neodev, though; just manual config.

@lewis6991 by disabling neodev in this codebase you mean using neoconf? I didn’t find anything else mentioning that in the README, but I might have missed it.

So I’m now confused about whether I need neodev at all, but I’m still unsure of what modifications I need to do to my lua_ls config :/

Don't include:

```lua
    workspace = {
        -- Make the server aware of Neovim runtime files
        library = vim.api.nvim_get_runtime_file("", true),
      }
```

When attaching to core.
Snippet?

> Don't include:
> 
> ```lua
>     workspace = {
>         -- Make the server aware of Neovim runtime files
>         library = vim.api.nvim_get_runtime_file("", true),
>       }
> ```
> 
> When attaching to core.

Pardon my ignorance, but wdym by attaching to core?

> @lewis6991 by disabling neodev in this codebase you mean using neoconf? 

No

> So I’m now confused about whether I need neodev at all, but I’m still unsure of what modifications I need to do to my lua_ls config :/

You don't need it. Just don't set library in your settings.

> Pardon my ignorance, but wdym by attaching to core? 

This repository.

> Snippet?
> 

Maybe look at my config. https://github.com/lewis6991/dotfiles/blob/main/config/nvim/lua/lewis6991/lsp.lua

Basically, just don't set library.

In fact all my settings aren't required for nvim-core.
Well, but if I _need_ `library` when working on, say, nvim-treesitter? Or my own config?

> Well, but if I _need_ `library` when working on, say, nvim-treesitter? 

Either add a .luarc.json to nvim-treesitter (like I do). Or dynamically setup library based on the root directory. Or don't set library when root marker is nvim core.

Setting `VIMRUNTIME` for nvim core is incorrect anyway since it points to a different `VIMRUNTIME`.
So you just made many people's lives more complicated. Color me unimpressed.

> > Pardon my ignorance, but wdym by attaching to core?
> 
> This repository.

Does this mean that I need to build neovim from source? I’m confused lol. As someone that just wants to get completions for `vim` APIs when tweaking my `.config/nvim` files, it sounds like I can just ditch neodev, make no further changes to my LSP configuration, and it _should just work_?

Sorry I’m slow. I’m not very smart at 1am. 

Anyway I think we should probably talk to Folke when he’s back from vacation because it would be a good idea to make these clarifications in neodev.

>  As someone that just wants to get completions for vim APIs when tweaking my .config/nvim files

In this case, this PR is completely irrelevant, and nothing has changed for you. (The file is only used when editing files in a cloned `neovim` repo.)

> > As someone that just wants to get completions for vim APIs when tweaking my .config/nvim files
> 
> In this case, this PR is completely irrelevant, and nothing has changed for you. (The file is only used when editing files in a cloned `neovim` repo.)

Oh lol 😂 well sorry then for the spam
Added some Lua snippets for LSP configuration to the description.
Raised: https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/2750

@MariaSolOs Seems neodev plugin is not needed.

1. I have created a `.luarc.json` file in my neovim config folder with following content:

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sumneko/vscode-lua/master/setting/schema.json",
  "workspace": {
    "library": [
      "/usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua",
      "/Users/towry/.local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-cmp/lua"
    ]
  }
}
```

2. Update neovim to the latest nightly build.
3. Update nvim-lspconfig plugin.
4. Remove neodev plugin and setup.

Here are the effects:

![截屏2023-08-08 21 12 53](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/8279858/57949614-d2ec-4e2f-9c5b-2c4adf8d60a0)

![截屏2023-08-08 21 07 50](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/8279858/9b2537f1-bd4c-4c50-9a4d-a5ea352d743e)

![截屏2023-08-08 21 06 10](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/8279858/188b3183-3b44-4dcf-a801-bb72758a9158)


---

- https://github.com/LuaLS/lua-language-server/wiki/Libraries#configuration-file
You can replace `/usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua` with `$VIMRUNTIME` and the other line can maybe use `$XDG_DATA_HOME`.

@lewis6991 why does your snippet for `on_init` return `true`? From what I can see [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/8afdc1f3867a620c8235b3d3964b019b94657190/runtime/lua/vim/lsp.lua#L1437), the return value is ignored on success.

Sorry if it's a silly question, just making sure I'm not missing something.

title: feat: add .luarc.json
